name: tidiness
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the condition or quality of having everything ordered and arranged in the right place: Students are expected to assist in maintaining the cleanliness and tidiness of classrooms. My father was always very particular about cleanliness and tidiness. See
tidy
More examplesFewer examplesWhen the kitchen had been restored to its former tidiness, he gave her a nod, and walked out. He said passengers would notice a rapid improvement in the appearance and tidiness of trains.The extreme tidiness of his garage was one of many subjects he was happy to talk about. She was a timid, well-spoken woman, obsessed with hygiene and tidiness. He was known for his obsessive tidiness, and glasses were washed as soon as guests left the house.
